page.title: 08HOUSING IN LONGSTANTON
page.content: Growth since the war has meant much new building in our D-block. Few old houses remain, even 19th Century ones. There are 197 houses on the two 50s-built{service family estates: Magdalene Close and Thornhill Place. Although comfortable, these houses seem a little austere in the 80s. The estates are spacious, but the lack of front gardens and mature trees leads to a certain drabness. Probably these homes are on a par with the village's 96{Council Houses. The new{private-ownership houses are mainly on three estates: Prentice Close, Ladywalk and Colesfield. These attractive houses, 98 in all, go to middle-class affluent newcomers who can consider prices often over Â£50000. It is a grievance of village people that there is little here when their own children are first-time buyers.
